title: P06-4007

sentences.text: This paper describes FERRET , an interactive question-answering -LRB- Q/A -RRB- system designed to address the challenges of integrating automatic Q/A applications into real-world environments .

FERRET utilizes a novel approach to Q/A known as predictive questioning which attempts to identify the questions -LRB- and answers -RRB- that users need by analyzing how a user interacts with a system while gathering information related to a particular scenario .

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents FERRET, an interactive question-answering system that aims to integrate automatic Q/A applications into real-world environments through a novel predictive questioning approach.

Entity-ferret.label: FERRET
Entity-ferret.description: FERRET is an interactive question-answering system that employs predictive questioning to enhance the integration of automatic Q/A applications in real-world environments.

Entity-system.label: system
Entity-system.description: The 'system' refers to FERRET, an interactive question-answering platform designed to integrate automatic Q/A applications into real-world environments.

Entity-interactive_question-answering.label: interactive question-answering
Entity-interactive_question-answering.description: Interactive question-answering refers to a system or method that facilitates a dynamic exchange of questions and answers between users and a system, exemplified by FERRET, which employs predictive questioning to enhance user interaction and information retrieval in real-world applications.

Entity-a_system.label: a system
Entity-a_system.description: In this context, 'a system' refers to the interactive question-answering framework that FERRET employs to analyze user interactions and gather relevant information for predictive questioning.

Entity-question.label: questions
Entity-question.description: In the context of the paper, 'questions' refers to the inquiries that the FERRET interactive question-answering system aims to identify and address based on user interactions while they gather information.

Entity-answer.label: answers
Entity-answer.description: In the context of the paper, 'answers' refers to the responses generated by the FERRET interactive question-answering system, which are identified through predictive questioning based on user interactions.

Entity-user.label: user
Entity-user.description: The term 'user' refers to an individual who interacts with the FERRET interactive question-answering system, providing input that helps the system identify their information needs.

Entity-information.label: information
Entity-information.description: In this context, 'information' refers to the data and knowledge that users gather while interacting with the FERRET question-answering system to address specific scenarios.

Entity-predictive_questioning.label: predictive questioning
Entity-predictive_questioning.description: Predictive questioning is a novel approach in interactive question-answering systems that identifies the questions and answers users need by analyzing their interactions with the system while they gather information about a specific scenario.

Entity-particular_scenario.label: particular scenario
Entity-particular_scenario.description: The 'particular scenario' refers to a specific context or situation in which users interact with the FERRET question-answering system, allowing it to analyze their needs for questions and answers.

Entity-scenario.label: scenario
Entity-scenario.description: In this context, 'scenario' refers to a specific situation or context in which users interact with the FERRET question-answering system to gather information.

Entity-qa.label: Q/A
Entity-qa.description: Q/A refers to an interactive question-answering system designed to integrate automatic question-answering applications into real-world environments.

Entity-automatic_qa_application.label: automatic Q/A applications
Entity-automatic_qa_application.description: Automatic Q/A applications are software systems designed to automatically answer questions posed by users, utilizing various algorithms and data sources to provide accurate and relevant responses.

Entity-real-world_environment.label: real-world environments
Entity-real-world_environment.description: real-world environments refer to the practical, everyday settings and contexts in which users interact with systems, particularly in the implementation of automatic question-answering applications.

summary: This paper describes FERRET , an interactive question-answering -LRB- Q/A -RRB- system designed to address the challenges of integrating automatic Q/A applications into real-world environments . FERRET utilizes a novel approach to Q/A known as predictive questioning which attempts to identify the questions -LRB- and answers -RRB- that users need by analyzing how a user interacts with a system while gathering information related to a particular scenario .

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' indicates a relationship where the subject provides an explanation, representation, or account of the object. It signifies that the subject conveys information or details about the object, enhancing the understanding of the object through the subject's perspective or analysis.

Predicate-is_a.label: is a
Predicate-is_a.description: The predicate 'is a' establishes a classification or categorization relationship between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject belongs to or is a member of the category defined by the object, thereby providing information about the nature or type of the subject in relation to the object.

Predicate-attempts_to_identify.label: attempts to identify
Predicate-attempts_to_identify.description: The predicate 'attempts to identify' signifies an action where the subject engages in a process or effort to recognize, determine, or ascertain the nature, characteristics, or specifics of the object. This implies a proactive endeavor to uncover or clarify the identity or details of the object in question.

Predicate-interacts_with.label: interacts with
Predicate-interacts_with.description: The predicate 'interacts with' denotes a relationship in which the subject engages in a reciprocal or mutual action with the object. This interaction can involve communication, manipulation, or any form of exchange that influences or affects both parties. It implies a dynamic connection where the subject and object are involved in a process that may lead to changes, responses, or outcomes based on their engagement.

Predicate-gathers.label: gathers
Predicate-gathers.description: The predicate 'gathers' indicates an action performed by the subject that involves the collection or accumulation of items, data, or resources, which are represented by the object. This action implies a process of bringing together various elements into a cohesive whole, often for the purpose of analysis, understanding, or utilization.

Predicate-related_to.label: related to
Predicate-related_to.description: The predicate 'related to' establishes a connection or association between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject has a relevant link, influence, or correlation with the object. This relationship can encompass various forms of relevance, such as contextual, thematic, or functional ties, suggesting that understanding one may provide insights into the other.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or example that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider scope or classification that includes the subject as one of its members.
